Description: Foot and stem sherd of Attic pottery kylix, probably Vicup; glazed black save for outside of foot and stand surface, plus inside of stem; inscription on underside; possible drill hole through centre of foot.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Between Site 3 (Hogarth) and the area of Site 19 (Hogarth), the 'Aphrodite shrine' (Hogarth et al. 1898-9, 32, 66)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
A possible drill hole through the centre of the foot may have been to render the cup unusable.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 32 and p. 56, no. 86, pl. 5, no. 86)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1457) (phase 3)
